str2: Appointed, arranged, fixed. From tasso; arranged, i.e. Appointed or stated.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Compound of heros and eidos; heroic; Herod, the name of four Jewish kings.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To put on, clothe (another). From en and duno; to invest with clothing.
From basileus; regal, i.e. belonging to the sovereign, or preeminent.
Clothing, raiment, vestment, robe. From hennumi; dress.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Another form for kathezomai; to seat down, i.e. Set; intransitively, to sit; figuratively, to settle.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of basis; a step, i.e. Foot-breath; by implication, a rostrum, i.e. A tribunal.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a compound of demos and agora; to be a people-gatherer, i.e. To address a public assembly.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
